required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Temporally Optimized Patterned Stimulation (TOPS®) Deep Brain Stimulation (DBS) for the Treatment of Parkinson's Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Randomized, Cross-Over Home-Use Study of TOPS® DBS for the Treatment of Parkinson's Disease

brief_summary.textblock: This study will test newly developed stimulation settings called Temporally Optimized Patterned Stimulation or TOPS, which can be used with an already implanted deep brain stimulation system. The purpose of this study is to determine if TOPS DBS can improve Parkinson's symptoms compared to Standard DBS.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Random order of presentation of all three TOPS and Standard DBS in each participant
study_design_info.masking_description: Participant and Outcomes Assessor blinded to DBS pattern in use

primary_outcome.measure: Movement Disorders Society-Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part III Motor score - Off medication/On DBS
primary_outcome.time_frame: After 1 week treatment period using each pattern
primary_outcome.description: Average difference between the best TOPS and Standard. The MDS-UPDRS Part III is the sum of 33 scores evaluating a set of Parkinson's disease motor symptoms on a scale from 0 to 4 points. A score of 0 indicates no symptom is present and a maximum score of 4 indicates the most severe symptom. The total scale range is 0-132, where higher scores indicate more severe symptoms.

primary_outcome.time_frame: After 1 week treatment period using TOPS1
After 1 week treatment period using TOPS2
After 1 week treatment period using TOPS3
After 1 week treatment period using Standard

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During 1 week treatment period using each pattern
secondary_outcome.description: Home use Parkinson's disease motor symptom diary recording On Time without dyskinesia, On Time with non-troublesome dyskinesia, On Time with troublesome dyskinesia, Off Time, and Asleep Time. Average "On Time" difference between the best TOPS and Standard

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After 1 week treatment period using each pattern
secondary_outcome.description: Average difference in Satisfaction between the best TOPS and Standard. Satisfaction is scored on a scale of 1 - 10 where 1 is Not at all satisfied and 10 is Fully satisfied

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During 1 week treatment period using each pattern
secondary_outcome.description: Parkinson's medication usage recorded in home use medication diary. Average difference between the best TOPS and Standard

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After 1 week treatment period using each pattern
secondary_outcome.description: Measured using Kinesia One system. Average difference between the best TOPS and Standard

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After 1 week treatment period using each pattern
secondary_outcome.description: Measured using Kinesia One system. Average difference between the best TOPS and Standard.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After 1 week treatment period using each pattern
secondary_outcome.description: Measured using Kinesia One system. Average difference between the best TOPS and Standard.

secondary_outcome.measure: Type and severity of side effects of stimulation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During 1 week treatment period using each pattern
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of participants experiencing side effects recorded in home use motor symptom diary and clinic. Average difference between the best TOPS and Standard

secondary_outcome.measure: Movement Disorders Society-Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part III Motor score - On medication/On DBS
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After 1 week treatment period using each pattern
secondary_outcome.description: Average difference between the best TOPS and Standard. The MDS-UPDRS Part III is the sum of 33 scores evaluating a set of Parkinson's disease motor symptoms on a scale from 0 to 4 points. A score of 0 indicates no symptom is present and a maximum score of 4 indicates the most severe symptom. The total scale range is 0-132, where higher scores indicate more severe symptoms.

arm_group.description: Participants receive TOPS1 for one week, followed by one week each of TOPS2, TOPS3, and Standard in random order.
Participants receive TOPS2 for one week, followed by one week each of TOPS1, TOPS3, and Standard in random order.
Participants receive TOPS3 for one week, followed by one week each of TOPS1, TOPS2, and Standard in random order.
Participants receive Standard for one week, followed by one week each of TOPS1, TOPS2, and TOPS3 in random order.

intervention.description: TOPS1 is an investigational novel pattern of stimulation that is programmed non-invasively into an already implanted DBS system
TOPS2 is an investigational novel pattern of stimulation that is programmed non-invasively into an already implanted DBS system
TOPS3 is an investigational novel pattern of stimulation that is programmed non-invasively into an already implanted DBS system
Standard is the pattern of stimulation that is usually delivered clinically by a DBS system

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed with Parkinson's disease
- Implanted with unilateral or bilateral subthalamic DBS System to treat Parkinson's disease at least 6 months prior to the study date
- Responds to DBS by having demonstrated a minimum improvement in motor score
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- Score of <24 on the Mini Mental Status Exam
- Abuses drugs or alcohol
- Pregnant
- History of significant cardiovascular, pulmonary, musculoskeletal, metabolic, or other neurological disorders (i.e. epilepsy, stroke)
- Prisoners, employees that report to investigators
